definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :1Sa 24:15 dog (NH id.; Ph. [[כלב]]; Aram. [[כַּלְבָּא]], kalbo0, Ar. kalbun; Eth. kalb: As. kalbu Dl:HWB 328)—abs. ´[[כ]] Ju Jdg 7:5 + 16 t., [[כָָּלֶב]] Ps 59:7, Ps 59:15; pl. [[כְּלָבִים]] 1Ki 14:11 + 12 t.; cstr. [[כַּלְבֵי]] Job 30:1; sf. [[כְּלָבֶיְ]] Ps 68:24; —dog:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: lit. 1Ki 14:11, 1Ki 16:4, 1Ki 21:19, 1Ki 21:19, 1Ki 21:23, 1Ki 21:24, 1Ki 22:38, 2Ki 9:10, 2Ki 9:36 (all of fierce, hungry dogs, devouring dead bodies and licking blood); cf. Je 15:3 and ([[לְשׁוֹן כְּלָבֶיְ]]) Ps 68:24; eating torn flesh, Ex 22:30 (E), [[כַּלְבֵי חאׁנִי]] = my sheep-dogs, only Job 30:1 (in both these with implied inferiority); dog-sacrifice was a heathen rite Is 66:3 (Di al.); v. esp. RS:Sem. i, 273 (291), 325 (343); in various sim. Ju Jdg 7:5, Pr 26:11, Pr 26:17, Ps 59:7, Ps 59:15; in proverbial sayings: [[לאׁ]] [[לִשׁׂנוֹ]] ´[[יֶחֱרַץ־כ]] Ex 11:7 (v. I. [[חרץ]]); [[מֵת טוֹב מִן־]] ´[[לְכ]] [[הָאַרְיֵה הַמֵּת]] Ec 9:4.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: applied, fig., to men, in contempt 1Sa 17:43, so of psalmist's enemies Ps 22:17, Ps 22:21, or in excessive humility 2Ki 8:13; still more emphatically [[מֵת]] ´[[כ]] a dead dog, [[הַמֵּת]] ´[[הַכּ]] 2Sa 9:8, 2Sa 16:9; also ´[[ראׁשׁ כ]] 2Sa 3:8; [[כְּלָבִים אִלְּמִים]] Is 56:10 (of misleading prophets), [[עַזֵּי נֶפֶשׁ]] ´[[הַכּ]] v:Is 56:11 (id.); ´[[כ]] was name given to male temple-prostitutes De 23:19 (v. Dr; cf. [[קָדֵשׁ]]).
